{"step_by_step_thinking": "The paravertebral block involves the injection of local anesthetic into the paravertebral space, which is located near the spinal nerves. According to Document [1], the injectate can spread to the paravertebral space, epidural space, intercostal space, and intervertebral foramina. Document [2] also mentions the possibility of the anesthetic spreading from the thoracic to the lumbar level of the paravertebral region. Document [10] also mentions the spread of the anesthetic to the epidural space, prevertebral, or to the contralateral side. However, none of the documents mention the spread of the anesthetic to the subarachnoid space.", "answer_choice": "B"}
